programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Raven is no bird brain. Its considered one of the smartest animals on the planet! The fox turtle can completely disappear inside its shell when threatened. The lion fish has become one of the most invasive and destructive species in the Atlantic Ocean!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The pufferfish is poisonous and if eaten by a human, the venom can affect one's diaphragm and can cause death by suffocation. And, in just 5 seconds, the hummingbird can flap its wings 350 times. Plus, the importance of the Elephant in the Serengeti.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We head to a winter wonderland in Banff, Alberta, Canada. Philippe joins the avalanche safety team at Ski Lake Louise as they show a few different ways of avalanche control including dynamite blasts on the mountain. We then head to the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a snowshoeing expedition. And finally we look at the dynamics of ice while climbing a frozen waterfall.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We look at different examples of cultural science. Starting off in Hawaii, Philippe paddles out on a 6-man canoe during a lesson in early Hawaiian navigation. Then it's off to Florida to join members of the Seminole tribe who show us different uses of plants as tools and food in the harsh terrain of the everglades. We wrap things up in the Pacific Northwest looking at the Suquamish tribe.

programme.title: UFC Unfiltered
programme.desc: With a fight card to look forward to, Jim and Matt invite a pair of all-action veterans on to the show in Andre Fili and Roman Dolidze. A longtime friend of the show, Andre Fili returns to UFC Unfiltered for the first time as a father in one of his most thoughtful interviews yet. He talks about the life changes since welcoming his son Valor, how fatherhood has shifted his mindset inside and outside the cage, and his upcoming matchup with Christian Rodriguez. Then, Roman Dolidze joins ahead of his middleweight main event against Anthony Hernandez. He talks about rebounding from back-to-back losses to a strong win streak, what’s at stake this weekend, and what it is about the Georgian UFC fighters that keeps them so driven. Stick around as Matt and Jim make their picks for Saturday’s UFC Fight Night card!

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Princeton, N.J. to get to know the fourth-overall pick in the 2025 PLL Draft: Coulter Mackesy. In this episode of THROUGH X, Mackesy sheds light on his highly touted squash background, explains how he found his one-of-a-kind shooting stroke, and discusses his desire to lead the Princeton Tigers back to an NCAA Championship before turning pro

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 28 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Jake Piseno joins the show! After Saturday's thrilling win over the Atlas, Jake describes just how special this Outlaws team is. Jake talks growing up in Syracuse, and why his favorite school growing up did not recruit him. The boys recap a crazy weekend in the PLL. Was Hoagie right about CJ Kirst? Doogs updates his MVP rankings. Is Coach Tierney on the hot seat? All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.desc: Darlene isolates herself from her co-workers at Wellman Plastics, leaving them with the impression she is an elitist snob.

programme.desc: It's Beverly Rose's first birthday -- but it's not all cake and candles -- when Becky and Emilio disagree on what kind of party they should have.

programme.desc: Darlene's friendship with a manager at Wellman Plastics lands her in an awkward situation; Louise's brother tries to win over Jackie.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre dé Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~£65,000 debt.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden at Longmeadow, Monty gives advice on what to plant under shrubs and roses, while in the vegetable garden, now that the soil has warmed up, he sows seeds for summer crops. In East Sussex, the show visits a nurseryman with a passion for orchids to get his tips for growing success, and in Oxfordshire, there's a couple who share an enthusiasm for gardening and growing vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty goes through the next steps of chilli seed growth and plants out some of the evergreen cuttings he has propagated. There's also plenty to be getting on with in the vegetable garden, including planting beans.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty revels in seasonal blossom and flowers, plants out his tomatoes and demystifies the myriad of different plant foods by demonstrating what, and when, to feed plants. Arit Anderson visits the peatlands of Cumbria, where she begins her journey looking into the use of peat in the horticultural industry.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds flowers for pollinators to his wildlife garden, creates an alpine trough and plants out tender veg in his vegetable garden. Adam Frost uses the wonders of technology when comedian Susan Calman contacts him for advice with her garden in Glasgow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy is at the Raven in Missouri trying to take advantage of some dry weather and get some Big Tine borderline planted and check off a long list of other summer time prep work as opening day of deer season will be here before we know it.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in Ethiopia hunting Mountain Nyala. After the first two days, Mark has taken a Menelik’s Bushbuck and a Colobus Monkey but no Mountain Nyala. Finally, on Day 3 the hunting party receives the green light from the military to hunt in the area they wanted. It's time to put the Gunwerks rifle to the test.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!
Follow Team200’s crew of traditional archers as they chase bigwhitetails in Canada!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s still opening week of bow season in Oklahoma and the crew has three tags left to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Full Strut
programme.desc: Mike has another unforgettable Turkey season in Missouri tagging out on two incredible Archery turkey hunts! Starting off with a close call he then follows up quickly with one wild hunt where he makes a perfect shot on a big mature gobbler that is on top of his decoy! After that it's a late morning gobbler that comes screaming in and Mike connects with him to fill his final tag!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy is at the Raven in Missouri trying to take advantage of some dry weather and get some Big Tine borderline planted and check off a long list of other summer time prep work as opening day of deer season will be here before we know it.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: Life on the Line
programme.desc: World record fly fisherman Nathaniel Linville shares his journey from troubled youth and addiction to redemption through fly fishing. After hitting rock bottom, he finds purpose in sobriety and relentless dedication, ultimately rising to the top as a world-record permit angler in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail
programme.desc: On this week's episode we're diving into a hot topic during this time of the year, Fall food plots. In a round table format, the guys answer what their favorite food plot blend is, why it works best for them, where the best locations to plant food plots are, when you should plant your food plots, and finally how to plant a fall food plot. Diving into a ton of different options from our great friends at @monsterbuck , our goal is to give you somewhere to start for fall plots to hunt over this coming 2025 season. If you have any questions, suggestions, or thoughts please drop a comment below and let's have a conversation. As always, thank you for taking the time to watch the video and we hope you enjoyed it!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.desc: Randy is at the Raven in Missouri trying to take advantage of some dry weather and get some Big Tine borderline planted and check off a long list of other summer time prep work as opening day of deer season will be here before we know it.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in Ethiopia hunting Mountain Nyala. After the first two days, Mark has taken a Menelik’s Bushbuck and a Colobus Monkey but no Mountain Nyala. Finally, on Day 3 the hunting party receives the green light from the military to hunt in the area they wanted. It's time to put the Gunwerks rifle to the test.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!
Follow Team200’s crew of traditional archers as they chase bigwhitetails in Canada!

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair and Brian Sanders and guest Capt. Garret George head way out into the gulf from everglades city Florida

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: After booking a trip at the last Indian River Clam Restoration banquete, the guys at Gold Key Roofing got a chance to fish with Capt. Blair and Capt. Mike Frenette.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s still opening week of bow season in Oklahoma and the crew has three tags left to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: Full Strut
programme.desc: Mike has another unforgettable Turkey season in Missouri tagging out on two incredible Archery turkey hunts! Starting off with a close call he then follows up quickly with one wild hunt where he makes a perfect shot on a big mature gobbler that is on top of his decoy! After that it's a late morning gobbler that comes screaming in and Mike connects with him to fill his final tag!

programme.title: Dirt

It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: After a volcano erupts on a South Sea island, a fallen priest and three convicts race to save the lives of children in a mountaintop leper colony.

programme.title: All The King's Men
programme.desc: A humble man rises to power as the populist governor of Louisiana until the influence of political corruption triggers his eventual downfall.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchóriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: Fools' Parade
programme.desc: The year is 1935, and James Stewart has been released from prison after serving a 40-year sentence. He wants nothing more than to claim the $25,000 waiting for him in a local bank, but the president of the bank doesn't want him to have it.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when Danny and the crew discover a truckload of unpleasant surprises hiding in a 1960 Cadillac Coupe de Ville that the client wants turned into a show car.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon turns to the shop for help when he takes on restoring a 1962 Karmann Ghia as an anniversary present for his wife.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Revisiting some of the most impressive paint jobs; a 1971 Road Runner gets a crazy new coat to commemorate a loved one; Rob Zombie's truck undergoes a transformation; a Harley transforms into a work of art inspired by the client's own tattoos.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny attempts to create a baddass muscle car from a 4-door sedan, and a one of a kind couch from the tail end of a Plymouth Roadrunner.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the Count's Kustoms crew rally together to help Shannon restore his father's long lost chopper. Meanwhile, Danny does a do-over on his customized 1990 Chevy Suburban.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the World Series of Poker guys want a Count's Kustoms chopper as the ultimate online giveaway, Danny is determined to make it something special.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Dee Snider from Twisted Sister drops by the shop to get a new "Sugar Bear" front end put on his Von Dutch chopper.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Tommy Lee's beloved bike gets crushed in an accident, he turns to the only person he trusts to fix it--the guys who built it--Count's Kustoms.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's got himself a new ride, a classic two wheel drive Chevy Blazer that he wants to trick out and flip for a big profit.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets a call from Kevin's brother who wants to sell Danny a 1969 Cadillac, but they can't let Kevin know or else he'll never trust his brother or Danny again.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny makes an old Ford Econoline look so cool that in the end, two buyers get into a bidding war for it. Danny can score big, but only if he can let his baby go.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Pawn Stars Rick Harrison shows up to give the guys of Count s Kustoms the project of a lifetime.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan works on a secret project for chopper shop Bones Legacy, while a Chevy Impala that redefines "lowrider" blinds Mike and Roli.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and Shannon honor fallen troops with a custom patriotic motorcycle. Later, Danny and Kevin push the limit to acquire a `71 Monte Carlo, and then have a tough decision.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew look at some of the most classic rides in the history of Counting Cars: a museum worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon; a 1960 Cadillac coupe; a tricked out '35 Ford pickup street rod; a 1953 Henry J Corsair.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Former Guns & Roses guitarist DJ Ashba arrives at Count's Kustoms in a 2004 Lamborghini Murcielago that he wants turned into the ultimate "mancar".

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After nearly thirty years, Danny decides it's finally time to restore his late father's rare 1982 Mercedes Benz 500 SEC AMG, the way he would have wanted to.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny sees something in his shop that makes him very uncomfortable, emptiness.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Two brothers want to surprise their dad with the ultimate car guy gift.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a customer all lined up to buy his 1967 Ford Bronco he's restoring, but Ryan's mistake has set the project way back.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When a client rolls into Count's Kustoms with a beautiful 1955 Chevy Nomad, Danny can't help but want the car for his collection.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop agrees to build a brave father a hot rod wheelchair, and Danny gets stuck in a bind when a pink car project doesn't go as planned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.desc: Gabe gets some help from an unlikely family member; Shelby's log buyer stops by for a surprise visit; Kraken and Katelyn find that logging without Capt. Clint might not be as easy as they thought.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man's equipment is sabotaged; Joe's shortcuts lead to trouble with the boss; Jason oversteps his boundaries and things get heated.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Belinda brings in a new assistant; Jason disagrees with Gabe's management style; Mike Papac bring in a long time friend of the family to help in the rigging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds a huge cache of logs in hard-to-navigate waters; Gabe risks his life trying to do too much; the Chapman team discovers someone is poaching its logs; the Dreadknots suffer a crippling injury; Joe is sent to teach a new logger.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A logging legend bails Gabe out of trouble; Shelby and an old friend use brute force to pull two logs; the Dreadknots bring in a new diver; the Chapman team looks to catch a log poacher.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Oakes Logging crashes onto the Rygaard families site; Shelby and Mike use redneck ingenuity to pull a huge and rare heart-pine log; the Papac team makes reckless Joe the new yarder operator; the Chapman team gets revenge on a suspected log poacher.

programme.desc: Shelby goes diving in gator infested waters; Rygaard and Oakes square off on a way road; the Dreadknots go their separate ways; fire breaks out on the mountain.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.desc: A guy from TX wants to combine the shell of a '66 C10 with a '60s Impala.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A long-time customer wants his F-250 4x4 lifted and made off-road ready.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the guys transform a wrecked 2017 F150 into a unique prerunner.

programme.desc: Hip-hop artist Slim Thug wants Ekstensive to dress up his old '59 Cadillac.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A client wants to set the bar for custom SUVs with a 2018 Yukon Denali.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and the guys have built a lot of trucks, but never a Ford Bronco.

programme.desc: A Camaro ZL1 gets performance upgrades and a GMC Sierra drops to the floor.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The crew squeezes the '18 Camaro ZL for more power with an engine rebuild.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The '70 Suburban is finally revived, and a '65 Belvedere II gets a Hemi,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A crumbling '52 Ford F4 milk truck becomes a dazzling diesel street rod.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A C10 gets new custom touches, and a Dodge Demon needs mods for the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A '70 Suburban is transformed, and an F-150 build will benefit charity.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 2018 Yukon Denali XL will be the shop's tallest build ever.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Converting a 1940 truck into a mobile barbecue pit tests the team's skills.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The team tries to outdo themselves with a redesign of 1950 Ford F5 COE.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: After a long pause, the team gets their chance to finish a 1968 Chevy C10.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill gets déjà vu on a 1985 Chevy C10 square body; a handmade chassis; after a close call, Ekstensive makes a 1923 T-Bucket street safe.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.
